botanical_details.potentially_harmful: Contact may cause skin allergies. Wear gloves and other protective equipment when handling
botanical_details.genus: Ficus can be evergreen or deciduous trees, shrubs or climbers, with often leathery, simple, entire or lobed leaves and tiny flowers borne within a hollow receptacle which enlarges to form the fruit

how_to_grow.cultivation: Under glass grow in loam-based potting compost with added fine bark chippings in full or filtered light. When in growth water moderately and apply a nitrogen rich fertiliser monthly. Keep just moist in winter. Plants benefit from regular misting and from being stood on a pebble tray, particularly in a warm dry atmosphere. Their main requirement is an even temperature, in winter not below 13°C and without the sharp fluctuations found in so many houses. Avoid draughty situations and keep them away from heater fumes
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed at 15 - 21 °C in spring or by semi-hardwood or leaf-bud cuttings in spring or summer
how_to_grow.pests: May be susceptible to glasshouse red spider mite and scale insects
